title: Zachary T. Rewolinski
text:
zachrewolinski@berkeley.edu
  
  
    
     zachrewolinski
  
  
      Zachary T. Rewolinski
  
  
    
     Zachary Rewolinski
  

  
  
I am a third-year PhD student in the Department of Statistics at UC Berkeley, advised by Bin Yu.
My research is primarily focused on ensuring that machine learning models are trustworthy of making real-world decisions in high-impact fields such as finance, medicine, criminal justice, and more. My research is supported by the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship.
I am also an Associate (part-time) Analyst with the San Diego Padres Research & Development team.
I graduated from Rice University in 2023 with a B.S. in Statistics, a B.S. in Computer Science, and a B.A. in Mathematics. While at Rice, I was fortunate to work with Genevera Allen.




Recent News

November 2025: I have returned to the San Diego Padres R&D team as an Associate Analyst.
October 2025: Our paper PCS Workflow for Veridical Data Science in the Age of AI has been accepted to Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society A!
June 2025: A preprint for our paper PCS Workflow for Veridical Data Science in the Age of AI is available.
June 2025: A preprint for our paper Local MDI+: Local Feature Importances for Tree-Based Models is available.
June 2025: I started my internship with the San Diego Padres Research & Development team.

title: Research
text:
Presentations
COVID-19 Policy Impacts on NO2, Ozone, and PM2.5 Levels in U.S. Cities (2021) Y. Choi, H. Louh, D. Cohan, D. Kowal, Z. T. Rewolinski, A. Nguyen, J. Li, A. Dayan, A. Abbott American Meteorological Society (AMS) Annual Meeting, Poster Presentation.
Responses of human activity & in-situ & satellite-observed air quality in U.S. cities to the COVID pandemic (2020) D. Cohan, D. Kowal, Y. Choi, J. Li, H. Louh, R. MacDonald, G. Meriano, A. Nguyen, L. Niu, Z. T. Rewolinski American Geophysical Union (AGU) Fall Meeting, Oral Presentation.
COVID-19 Policy Impacts on NO2, Ozone, and PM2.5 Levels in U.S. Cities (2020) H. Louh, Y. Choi, J. Li, A. Nguyen, Z. T. Rewolinski, D. Kowal, D. Cohan American Geophysical Union (AGU) Fall Meeting, Poster Presentation.
Impacts of COVID-19 Pandemic on Activity and Emissions (2020) Z. T. Rewolinski, J. Li, A. Nguyen, D. Cohan, D. Kowal Community Modeling and Analysis Systems (CMAS) Conference, Oral Presentation.
An Analysis of the Relationship Between Pitcher Size and UCL Tears (2019) Z. T. Rewolinski Society for American Baseball Research (SABR) National Convention, Poster Presentation. - Best Poster Award

title: Blog
text: My blog is over on Substack, which might be a little bit overkill for what I intend for it to be. Thus far most of my blog ideas are related to education policy, but I will likely branch into more AI-centered topics relevant to my PhD as time goes on.
